div.a: April 9, 2020- Asynchronous Learning & Accessing Google Classroom

span.p: **Please note: There was an error in the latest communication regarding how to access Google Classroom. We apologize for the inconvenience.**

In order for students to access Google Classroom, they should use their student email (first initial, last initial, lunch number@student.waterbury.k12.ct.us) to log in. For example, js123456@student.waterbury.k12.ct.us. You can find helpful tutorials at: https://bit.ly/2X4JgN8. If a student is unable to log in or has difficulty with accessing their Google Classroom, please email tech@waterbury.k12.ct.us.

a.title: Click to read more about: April 9, 2020- Asynchronous Learning & Accessing Google Classroom

COVID-19 Closure- Meal Service and Distance Learning

p.span: Breakfast and lunch can be picked up at any one of the 25 schools between9:00 a.m. and 12:00 p.m. Students and parentsmay pick up meals from the school site most convenient to their home even if their child is not enrolled in that school. Click here for a full list of the locations.

span.em: *Please note: For students who do not have access to the online learning plan, supplemental learning materialsfor Pre-Kthrough 12th grade are also available at each location.

p.span: To access the District's DistanceLearning Plan, clickhere.
Internet Access: The Governors Office has compiled a comprehensive list of Internet providers offering various packages and offers to help get Connecticut residents online and stay connected.

span.b: For a complete list of providers offering online access in various ways, click
